job_title: Counselor/ Educator for Be Priceless for summer onwards (English and Chinese/Urdu/Nepali//Bahasa)
description:
Role: Counselor/ Educator for Be Priceless, an educational non-profit organization that strengthens disadvantaged children’s well-being and safety.

Seeking candidate with a passion to empower and serve disadvantaged communities and has extensive experience in teaching and school counseling or social work, as well as service to vulnerable children. Short term contract for school summer break 2022. 


Job Highlight:

Opportunity to drive the development of an educational program that serves disadvantaged children and youth during 2022 summer break
Drive the coordination and collaboration with diverse professionals, community members, child and youth in empowering ways
Be part of an innovative and dynamic team of multisectoral professionals and community members.
Empowering, positive, collaborative organizational culture

 Key Jobs Responsibilities

Coordinate and implement the Be Priceless educational program (which builds capacity for growth, well-being and safety of children), including creation of content, teaching, evaluation and keep improving the SEED courses.
Manage the educational and well-being program development. This includes facilitating collaboration of volunteers, consultant and staff from diverse backgrounds and expertise.
Foster stakeholder’s engagement and collaboration– including children, youth, caregivers, multi-disciplinary professionals, schools, non-profit organization.

Job Requirement:

Passionate and dedicated in promoting child and youth well-being and protection.
At least 3 years of relevant experience in education and counselling role in reputable organization/School.
Degree in education, psychology, social work or related field
Experienced in creating educational program for children of 5-17 years old that promotes social-emotional learning, well-being, safety and inclusion. 
Experienced in developing and implementing e-learning educational programs.
Experienced in team, project and resource management
Adaptive, flexible and collaborative
Strong ethical and professional standard - including accountability, transparency.
Strong collaboration, coordination and problem solving skills.
Strong communication, productivity, organization and time management skills.
Social media management proficiency
Professional level written and spoken English 
Additional professional level written and spoken 1 of the following languages is required: Chinese, Nepali, Urdu, Hindi, Tagalog, or Bahasa.
Undergoing regular background checks (including Sexual Conviction Record Check (SCRC)  and previous employment checks) and abiding to code of conduct including for child safeguarding-protection are an absolute requirements. We have continuous and rigorous monitoring of issues of concerns safety of children and other vulnerable individuals. We will investigate/ report where appropriate.

Logistics: Full-time contract base, candidate must be in Hong Kong
Duration: Summer program and beyond, to be extended to long-term contract if performance is outstanding
Salary: based on experience 

Please apply with your full resume, cover letter, time availability. and expected salary.

job_title: Research Assistant I/II (several posts) (Ref.: 511380)
description:
Work type: Full-time
Department: Department of Psychiatry (21500)
Categories: Research Support Staff

Research Assistant I/II (several posts) in the Department of Psychiatry (Ref.: 511380) (to commence as soon as possible on a one-year temporary basis or two-year fixed-term basis, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance)

This is an exciting opportunity for the appointee to join the multidisciplinary PSI team based at the Department of Psychiatry, University of Hong Kong. The PSI team, made up of enthusiastic and highly motivated researchers and clinicians, is internationally renowned for its contribution towards clinical research in psychiatry and mental disorders. The Team’s research provides significant insight and acts as an important informer for front-line mental health services.

Applicants should possess a Bachelor’s degree in psychology, social sciences, or other healthcare-related disciplines. They should have an excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese, the willingness to learn new skills, a strong commitment to high quality research, good organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills, and the ability to prioritize work and maintain a high level of effectiveness. The team is looking for an individual with high calibre to take part in clinical research projects with diverse interests, such as interventions and outcome measures of early psychotic disorders, or large-scale youth mental health assessments and services. 

The appointee will work closely with professional researchers and clinicians to deliver and evaluate community assessments. He/She will also provide protocol-based interventions and support to people with mental health difficulties.  This position would be ideal for someone wanting to gain in research and interventions that target early onset mental disorders, and to be equipped with substantial clinical skills at the same time.  Those who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 508724) need not re-apply.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits. The appointment on fixed terms will attract a contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme totalling up to 10% of basic salary.

The University only accepts online applications for the above posts. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until February 28, 2022, or until the posts are filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Dec 29, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Feb 28, 2022 (HK Time)

Strong interpersonal skills and a troubleshooting-oriented mindset that enables working with a multicultural group of professionals

Deep interest and experience in public engagement strategy and implementation
Experience in stakeholder management and planning and ability to collaborate with senior stakeholders across multiple sites / global locations

A dynamic, fast paced environment
A vibrant and international team with diverse background
Steep learning curve in e-commerce & entrepreneurship
Learning & development programs and skills trainings 
Flexible working hours and agile company with a flat hierarchical structure
Monthly staff allowance and corporate discounts including at restaurants, gyms and many more
Agile office environment with a fully-stocked beverage fridge and self-serve beer

description:
KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY:

1) Project management

Develop, plan, and execute parenting and mental health programme activities or events and dissemination works, including producing publication materials, organizing workshops, program enrollment, venue set-up and client management
Coordinate and liaise with related external parties including programme facilitators, schools, community groups, corporates and other key stakeholders
Collect activity data, monitor progress against both programmatic and budgetary targets and support conduct of evaluations to ensure programme improvement and quality
Provide input for development of domestic program strategy and project monitoring and evaluation tools and process
Support on a variety of other projects or activities as requested, including but not limited to Save the Children Hong Kong direct service programmes and new initiatives
2) Administration support

Support in coordinating maintenance of centre facilities and equipment
Receive and direct visitors and clients
Perform general clerical duties including photocopying, fax and mailing, managing filling system & project database
Provide operational and administrative support to related research and campaigns, including documentary and data entry
Produce accurate and timely reports

3) Assist in other program activities or organizational projects as needed


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

University graduate preferably major in Early Childhood Education, Social Science, Special Education, Counselling or related disciplines
At least 3 years’ experience in teaching children
Experiences in working with parents and psychosocial support projects are preferred
Strong presentation skills and inter-personal communication skills
Ability to work independently and with a team
Willing to engage with different types of individual and community groups
Computer skills and communications technologies, basic knowledge on graphic design and website operation is a plus (Microsoft Office, Zoom, Adobe, Photoshop and AI etc.)
Keen interest and commitment to the best interest of children
High degree of self-motivation and strong sense of responsibility
Excellent proficiency in written and oral English and Cantonese

job_title: Educator for Be Priceless (English and Chinese/Urdu/Nepali/Hindi/Tagalog/Bahasa)
description:
Role: Educator for Be Priceless, an educational non-profit organization that strengthens disadvantaged children’s well-being and safety.

Seeking candidate with a passion to empower and serve disadvantaged communities and has extensive experience in teaching and school counseling or social work, as well as service to vulnerable children.


Job Highlight:

Opportunity to drive the development of an educational program that serves disadvantaged children and youth.
Drive the coordination and collaboration with diverse professionals, community members, child and youth in empowering ways
Be part of an innovative and dynamic team of multisectoral professionals and community members.
Empowering, positive, collaborative organizational culture

 Key Jobs Responsibilities

Coordinate and implement the Be Priceless educational program (which builds capacity for growth, well-being and safety of children), including creation of content, teaching, evaluation and keep improving the SEED courses.
Manage the educational and well-being program development. This includes facilitating collaboration of volunteers, consultant and staff from diverse backgrounds and expertise.
Foster stakeholder’s engagement and collaboration– including children, youth, caregivers, multi-disciplinary professionals, schools, non-profit organization.

Job Requirement:

Passionate and dedicated in promoting child and youth well-being and protection.
At least 3 years of relevant experience in education and counselling role in reputable organization.
Degree in education, psychology, social work or related field
Experienced in creating educational program for children of 5-17 years old that promotes social-emotional learning, well-being, safety and inclusion. 
Experienced in developing and implementing e-learning educational programs.
Experienced in team, project and resource management
Adaptive, flexible and collaborative
Strong ethical and professional standard - including accountability, transparency.
Strong collaboration, coordination and problem solving skills.
Strong communication, productivity, organization and time management skills.
Social media management proficiency
Professional level written and spoken English 
Additional professional level written and spoken 1 of the following languages is required: Chinese, Nepali, Urdu, Hindi, Tagalog, or Bahasa.
Undergoing regular background checks (including Sexual Conviction Record Check (SCRC)  and previous employment checks) and abiding to code of conduct including for child safeguarding-protection are an absolute requirements. We have continuous and rigorous monitoring of issues of concerns safety of children and other vulnerable individuals. We will investigate/ report where appropriate.

Logistics: Full-time, candidate must be in Hong Kong
Duration: 3 month probation, to be extended to long-term contract if performance is satisfactory.
Salary: based on experience 

Please apply with your full resume, cover letter, time availability. and expected salary.

job_title: SEN Pre-school Teacher / Special Child Care Worker/ ECE Teacher/QKT Teacher/ Register Teacher
description:
SEN Pre-school Teacher (Ref. SENT) / Special Child Care Worker (Ref. SCCW)/ ECE/QKT Teacher/ Register Teacher

Responsibilities:

Consistently provide an excellent standard of teaching for young children with a wide variety of abilities.
 Assess both formally and informally and devise individual learning plans.
 Create interesting and engaging teaching plans.
 Work closely with parents within the classroom.
 Be part of a multidisciplinary team, lead and contribute to meetings both with staff and parents.
The ability to write reports in both English and Chinese will be an advantage.
Demonstrate professional knowledge of early childhood development.
Plan interesting and engaging lessons for a variety of classes for children aged between birth and six years old.
Set appropriate developmental goals and devise activities to meet those goals.
Maintain up to date, organised records and reports regarding children’s learning.
Maintain up to date, organised lesson plans.
Develop positive relationships with parents.
Supervise classroom assistants and/or volunteers.
Create organised and tidy classrooms with interesting visual and sensory materials.
Be a contributing member of a multi-disciplinary team

Requirements:

A recognised relevant degree in SEN teaching or Special Child Care Work
Further qualifications in the area of special needs desirable.
A minimum of two years Special Child Care Worker experience with pre-school or school-aged children is desirable.
Experienced in teaching children with autism, PMLD, CLD and those who need behavioural and sensory support.
Familiar with AACs, PECS, and Makaton.
Fluent Cantonese and English, written and spoken, Mandarin an advantage.
Excellent communication skills.
A strong work ethic with a positive attitude.
Excellent observation and assessment skills.
Hong Kong permanent resident status is desirable.
Be able to work under pressure and be flexible.
Must be able to work Saturdays.
Job Package/Benefits:

Paid professional development opportunities.
Medical and dental benefits.
Five-day working week (may include Saturday and or early evening).
Friendly working environment.

job_title: Student Guidance Officer (two posts)
Social Work Officer (at the rank of Student Advising Officer) (several posts)
description:
Social Work Officer (at the rank of Student Advising Officer) (several posts) in the LKS Faculty of Medicine (Ref.: 511317) (to commence as soon as possible, on a two-year fixed-term basis with contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 10% of basic salary, with the possibility of renewal)

Applicants should possess a recognised degree or equivalent in Social Work from a local university, and be registered with the Hong Kong Social Workers Registration Board. They should have at least 2 years’ relevant experience in healthcare or a NGO-related ﬁeld, preferably with experience working with cancer patients and their caregivers. They should also have good counselling skills, knowledge of and interest in digital health intervention, excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese, strong communication and interpersonal skills, analytical thinking, empathy, and commitment to patient care.

The appointees will join the HKU Jockey Club Institute of Cancer Care (HKU JCICC) team to develop evidence-based supportive cancer care services. They will be responsible for (i) providing counselling service for cancer patients and their caregivers; (ii) developing digital health intervention/education for cancer patients and their caregivers; (iii) driving the team’s social media work by designing overall strategies and creating public education materials; (iv) planning and conducting patient groups; (v) delivering large-scale education programmes; and (vi) conducting research in relevant areas. Irregular working hours will be required occasionally.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

The University only accepts online application for the above posts. Applicants should apply online at the University’s careers site (https://jobs.hku.hk) and upload an up-to-date C.V. Review of applications will start from January 4, 2022 and continue until January 20, 2022, or until the posts are filled, whichever is earlier.

The University is an equal opportunities employer and
is committed to equality, ethics, inclusivity, diversity and transparency
